intro: Rosa arvensis sincera, commonly known as the field rose, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces fragrant, pink to white flowers with five petals, which bloom in the summer months. Rosa arvensis sincera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. It is a perennial shrub that is native to Europe and parts of Asia.
